intro: Marica bogotensis, commonly known as the Bogotá marica, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of Colombia. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as montane forests and cloud forests. Its leaves are usually ovate with a smooth texture, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
